Issues.Title: Add .gitattributes and renormalize line endings
Issues.Body:
Added a copy of (mostly) the .gitattributes from dotnet/runtime.

Also ran `git add --renormalize .` to fixup any issues with line endings.

I tested this out with autocrlf enabled and disabled and it all seems to work fine.  Files I was editing earlier today that resulted in large whitespace diffs no longer show these issues.

With autocrlf off and a fresh clone, I ran a search (via `file`) to find everything with CR/LF endings and this renormalized list seems to match that.  So I believe things are all fixed up.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add .gitattributes and renormalize line endings" (#2721)

Issues.Title: Copy-wpf.ps1 file doensn't work as expected
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version: 3.1.200-preview-015002
Windows version: Windows 10.0.18363
Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

Managed and unmanaged files aren't copied due to the wrong source string directories.
For managed file :
- current string path: "...wpf\artifacts\packaging\Debug\Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.GitHub\lib\netcoreapp5.0"
- right string path "...wpf\artifacts\packaging\Debug\Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.GitHub.Debug\lib\netcoreapp5.0"

For unmanaged file:
- current string path: "...wpf\artifacts\packaging\Debug\Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.GitHub.Debug\lib\win-x86"
- right string path ...wpf\artifacts\packaging\Debug\Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.GitHub.Debug\runtimes\win-x86\native

CopyNativeBinariesToLocation, CopyManagedBinariesToLocation and CopyPackagedBinaries functions  should be modified
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Copy-wpf.ps1 file doensn't work as expected" (#2726)

Issues.Title: Add sdk.version entry to global.json
Issues.Body:
Adds `sdk.version` entry to `global.json` which tells msbuild SDK resolver which SDK version to look for when looking for `Microsoft.NET.Sdk`

Detailed explanation at https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/2714#issuecomment-595419219

Fixes #2714
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add sdk.version entry to global.json" (#2718)

Issues.Title: Unable to compile using build.cmd file
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version: 3.1.200-preview-015002
Windows version: 10.0.18363
Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No
Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

Compiling using build.cmd, I'm getting the error: **"The .NET Core SDK cannot be found. Verify that it is installed and that any version specified by global.json matches the installed version"**

Trying to compile by Visual Studio the error is:
**"error NETSDK1045: The current .NET SDK does not support targeting .NET Core 5.0.  Either target .NET Core 3.1 or lower, or use a version of the .NET SDK that supports .NET Core 5.0."**

It seems that **Net Core 5** version is required, but no version is available for download.

Thank you.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unable to compile using build.cmd file" (#2714)

Issues.Title: in App.xmal  add FontFamily can't usable
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:.net core 3.1
* Windows version: 1909
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019).
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
I use WPF(.net core)。 in app.xaml add FontFamily like this:
```
<FontFamily x:Key="Digital-7 Mono">
    pack://application:,,,/IVFTempMonitor;component/Fonts/Digital7Mono-B1g5.ttf#Digital-7 Mono
</FontFamily>
```
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2587129/75935098-49e61e80-5eb9-11ea-9dd0-5cef3ad9bf64.png)

in mainwindow.xaml use like this:
```
<Border
            Grid.Row="1"
            Grid.Column="0"
            Margin="3"
            Background="{StaticResource BootstrapCyan}">
            <TextBlock
                HorizontalAlignment="Center"
                VerticalAlignment="Center"
                FontFamily="{StaticResource 'Digital-7 Mono'}"
                FontSize="40"
                Foreground="White"
                Text="{Binding One}" />
</Border>
```

 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 but it's not usable.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2587129/75935381-04762100-5eba-11ea-9f7f-4f25f6a50a6f.png)

when I use WPF(.net framework)，the code as the same. It's usable.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2587129/75935431-1f489580-5eba-11ea-9eea-3eb680d7aed0.png)


 **Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "in App.xmal  add FontFamily can't usable" (#2709)

Issues.Title: The border of ComboBox is not fully displayed in designer
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.2
* Windows version: 19H2
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.7.2: Yes

**Repro steps:**
1. Create a new WPF Core project.
2. Open toolbox, double click the ComboBox, you will see ComboBox shows normal in designer, xaml code like this: `<ComboBox x:Name=“comboBox” Width=“120”/>`
3. Selected the ComboBox, set attributes Height=“50” IsEditable=“True”, xaml code like this: `<ComboBox x:Name=“comboBox” Width=“120” Height=“50” IsEditable=“True”/>`
4. Observe the ComboBox, you will see part border of ComboBox will disappear. If you don’t see the border disappeared, please run the following steps.
5. F5-> type some character into the ComboBox->stop debugging ->Observe the ComboBox.

**Expected:**
ComboBox shows normal in designer.

**Actual:**
Part border of the ComboBox is missing unless you set your zooming at 100%
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29625285/75955041-1377c600-5ef0-11ea-9304-15e0bfce18d1.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The border of ComboBox is not fully displayed in designer" (#2712)
